00F9BF5B4CE947B59B7F628ED6A92E20.description:
develop age-appropriate behaviour for social involvement as responsible citizens
contributing to their community

30FA6483B573417281837EF6CFD466A1.description: demonstrate skills of decision making and problem solving

87751AEE2A134A2388F23011FA58BC50.description: What effects have La Société Radio-Canada (SRC) and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) had on Canadian identity?

DBB6216C13564B5CAD011ADB8D5D6BEF.description: In what ways did technological advances contribute to the development of Canada (e.g., aviation, farming equipment, radio transmissions, electronics, multimedia)

5EFC2951C1A74331A4B2156679F58A38.description: How did the emergence of large factories in Canada contribute to the development of Canada’s economy?

4842A57DE0324A968BE454509810B601.description: What impact has increased urbanization had on rural communities in Canada?

CA037EEB298441E39FF01598653FC503.description: assess, critically, the impact of urbanization and of technology on individual and collective identities in Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

A33FDB21E21247889BDFECB7AB1DB2F3.description: What strategies and conditions are needed for the Franco-Albertan community to counter assimilation?

B89391258F874DDDA73157E0A5660D14.description: How have Canadian immigration policies contributed to increased diversity and multiculturalism within the Canadian population?

980C8D537AEB4FB49AAC1977B4B38811.description: How has the Official Languages Act contributed to bilingualism in Canada?

CBF3BB44EBAC490D96C3674DD0793522.description: What challenges and opportunities have emerged as a result of increases in the Aboriginal population in western Canada?

FC5233B5AF2D410883E4B027E2284F95.description: What are the social and economic effects of the changing roles and images of women in Canadian society (i.e., right to vote, working conditions, changing family structures)?

7E11DBF9B3254E238742AEE288275FBB.description: How did joining Confederation impact the citizens of Newfoundland?

1B9D67873AEF41E88277D27F4483B350.description: What were the reasons for, and the consequences of, Newfoundland’s joining Confederation?

E9361578A9D748AD943F2610C2968F58.description: assess, critically, the impacts of social and political changes on individual and collective identities in Canada since 1918 by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

AD238E8C4F4C4939904CBFA7DB9539C2.description: What were the underlying reasons for the negotiation of the numbered treaties?

6A65B28851154FF98B82408B6AA8F200.description: How were the needs of varied populations considered through the creation of Alberta and of Saskatchewan?

78C49518D74E41BBA34B06B03EC7FE9A.description: What factors led to Prince Edward Island’s joining Confederation?

ECA090F37E3E4E619C138B58C9E9CC35.description: What factors led to British Columbia’s joining Confederation?

0B609D1E5F3A4912B5BAC7D0E1247B52.description: To what extent was agricultural activity a key factor in the population growth of western Canada?

2671288FD66F42F2B2E967A67781CEE8.description: How did immigrants from eastern Europe contribute to the development of western Canada (i.e., health, education, churches, commerce, politics, journalism, agriculture)?

C6E1F815ED404AB48EFC77ECE62B17B4.description: How did communities, services and businesses established by Francophones contribute to the overall development of western Canada (i.e., health, education, churches, commerce, politics, journalism, agriculture)?

0CC4D74A391546B0B772854766C15589.description: What impact did immigration have on Aboriginal peoples and on communities in Canada?

8346A4A351CF48E19A710767B96F94D2.description: What strategies were used by religious communities and missionaries to encourage migration and immigration to western Canada from eastern Canada and the United States?

C8A51080B1FA4DA18D84A4B08ACBBDBC.description: What strategies were used by the government to encourage immigration from Europe?

77BF0CA13A74489E8952E752D52F2CD3.description: What was the role of the North West Mounted Police in the development of western Canada?

4AE129FAC08543F98A958078961F5901.description: In what ways did the building of the Canadian Pacific Railway affect the growth of Canada?

E82E35CB7A374A0BA66C39C0B70A4B2E.description: How did Asian immigrants contribute to the development of Canada (i.e., Chinese railway workers)?

EBC9709A22894409991C29933F8DABE5.description: How did changing demographics resulting from Clifford Sifton’s immigration policies affect the collective identity of Francophones in communities across western Canada?

42FCDAFE85094253B3F6F2C16282970E.description: How did the National Policy determine the economic and demographic aspects of Canadian expansion?

FEA83F2AF605439FB0B82D78FC18E29E.description: What factors led to the purchase of Rupert’s Land in 1869?

8C8F8AB6DE3A470F812B857512F2F96C.description: evaluate the impact of Confederation and of subsequent immigration on Canada from 1867 to the First World War by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

6CE0F1453DD643A18706D7B79E0B10B2.description: To what extent were the Manitoba Schools Act and evolving educational legislation in the Northwest Territories attempts to impose a British identity in western Canada?

8D8825C56A624AF4BDFAE0E29DC65210.description: How was the creation of Manitoba an attempt to achieve compromise between the Métis, First Nations, French and British peoples?

91D4925C9B534D5A8E8ACC688DB51C04.description: What were the Métis, First Nations, French and British perspectives on the events that led to the establishment of Manitoba?

1029773672F44782A9381274B33B3AA5.description: To what extent were the Red River Resistance and the second Métis uprising means to counter assimilation?

A4404827BDFA4C55BCECC60EC514F8AC.description: How did the Government of Canada’s response to the Red River Resistance and the second Métis uprising solidify Canada’s control of the West?

9F8BB49AEE7C48EA8630D3728CCB2EFC.description: What similarities and differences exist between the causes of the Red River Resistance in 1869 and the causes of the second Métis uprising in 1885?

0AEFCC2F29BA43058B50937EB1F378EF.description: What factors led to Louis Riel’s emergence as the leader of the Métis?

E97305611A9A44559520C0F68142D468.description: assess, critically, the role, contributions and influence of the Red River Métis on the development of western Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

2F51799CEE7D4245B68E07EC028FC74B.description: appreciate the challenges that individuals and communities face when confronted with rapid change

6510954F8F9F400CAAB829BFD38810F1.description: recognize the positive and negative consequences of political decisions

5B33473E34A64D3A91163313383E5126.description: recognize the positive and negative aspects of immigration and migration

6C97851CFA8C4F3E86B870556FD66813.description: To what extent was Confederation an attempt to strengthen the Maritime colonies?

6564CF61E86141DE83535E637E63CB66.description: To what extent was Confederation an attempt to provide the populations of Québec and Ontario with increased control over their own affairs?

EF58D43AC18044C0BE6F26BD25C2656D.description: How was the Act of Union of 1840 an attempt to resolve the issues raised by the 1837 and 1838 Rebellions in Lower Canada and Upper Canada?

82F216AD4EC14370A2E8AEDC359FAB4B.description: How was the Great Migration of 1815–1850 in Upper Canada and Lower Canada an attempt to confirm British identity in the Province of Canada?

E3419F9289DA40C99DFFA3709CA37C83.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to defining Canada’s political boundaries?

AC6B684D65514000807B4A2FF78262CB.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to British identity in Canada?

9FABE01FB3E74A319BEB2FFB170F65AA.description: How did the Québec Act of 1774 contribute to the foundations of Canada as an officially bilingual country?

061FF4B32DC84AF8BD3A8F1C97646948.description: How was the Royal Proclamation of 1763 an attempt to achieve compromise between the Aboriginal peoples, the French and the British?

BC6298DFD7D64B6BA2E18E8E0EE81FE5.description: What was the role and intent of Chief Pontiac in controlling British forts?

026D5AA360164C6CAF7DEF297CDA543A.description: assess, critically, how political, economic and military events contributed to the foundations of Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

09D1795DF2A6498A88348A2178AE196E.description: How was British North America impacted by rebellion in the 13 colonies and by the subsequent Loyalist migration?

C7EA0BB6EA5F46338E1FDA23567D67EB.description: To what extent was the Battle of the Plains of Abraham the key event in achieving British control over North America?

6538139246554FC88CBCD1B28F9FE5E6.description: How did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe become factors in the Great Deportation of the Acadians in 1755?

E69E4D1D68B844EF8DDE8D243442BEE1.description: In what ways did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe impact North America?

91C2D9C167E64183B5C481D624E86DF1.description: assess, critically, the political competition between the French and the British in attempting to control North America by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

85CDB7E5D3B64889817580948D3554EC.description: What was the role of mercantilism before and after the 1763 Treaty of Paris?

E1079AE3905341268B929BF424D2DDD7.description: assess, critically, the economic competition related to the control of the North American fur trade by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

524BBD9417E845A4AB989DEE04BB3A45.description: What were the social and economic factors of European imperialism?

7FD9B348A05048CC90DA3BF3A46876CB.description: How did the structures of Aboriginal societies affect decision making in each society (i.e., role and status of women, consensus building)?

7ED14CFB281D47059BE2772A06D905EE.description: What were the different ways in which Aboriginal societies were structured (i.e., Iroquois Confederacy, Ojibwa, Mi’kmaq)?

8663DB1373FB435A904EBC6A9A241A86.description: compare and contrast diverse social and economic structures within the societies of Aboriginal, French and British peoples in pre-Confederation Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

B405DE8261914DEBA2C4F838D56D725F.description: appreciate the challenges of co-existence among peoples

B72C265F5BE04BD49A04D99EE8953399.description: appreciate the influence of diverse Aboriginal, French and British peoples on events leading to Confederation
